article.headline: Montana 72, Idaho St. 63
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Andrew Strait had 22 points and 10 rebounds and, Jordan Hasquet added 13 points, 12 rebounds and six assists, helping Montana earn a come-from-behind 72-63 overtime victory over Idaho State on Sunday. After trailing by six points with four minutes left, the Grizzlies (13-14, 7-7 Big Sky) got the game into overtime on a 3-pointer by Hasquet with 16.1 seconds left that tied the score at 58 at the end of regulation play. Ryan Staudacher scored five of his 10 points for the Grizzlies in the overtime. The Bengals (10-17, 7-7) were led by Amorrow Morgan, with 14 points; Donnie Carson, with 13 points, and Demetrius Monroe, with 11 points and eight rebounds. Strait scored 13 points in the first half as Montana took a 34-33 lead at the half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
